thread.title: GM Agrees To Settle 50 New Death Cases Related To Ignition Switch - Total Reaches 174
thread.title_full: GM Agrees To Settle 50 New Death Cases Related To Ignition Switch - Total Reaches 174 - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: GM Agrees To Settle 50 New Death Cases Related To Ignition Switch - Total Reaches 174
text:
Hilliard Munoz Gonzales LLP
CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas , Sept. 17, Bob Hilliard , appointed by the Federal Judge in the GM MDL litigation to be the lead attorney for all personal injury and death cases caused by GM's defective ignition switch, reports that GM has settled 50 new death cases.
As part of the settlement reached late last night between Bob Hilliard's 1379 clients and GM, there are included 50 death cases. As of August 21, 2015 GM has settled 124 death cases through the GM Ignition Switch Compensation Fund, administered by Ken Feinberg .
Yesterday's settlement with Hilliard's clients brings the total number of official death cases acknowledged by GM to 174.
ABOUT HMG http://www.hmglawfirm.com/
Hilliard Muñoz Gonzales LLP (HMG) specializes in mass torts, personal injury, product liability, commercial and business litigation, and wrongful death. Hilliard Muñoz Gonzales LLP has been successfully representing clients in the United States and Mexico since 1986. Bob Hilliard obtained the Largest Verdict in the country in 2012 and the #1 verdict in Texas in 2013.
HMG is actively seeking to represent other victims of GM's defective vehicles.
SCHEDULE AN INTERVIEW WITH BOB HILLIARD
Contact Adolfo Martinez at 361-960-9619
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/gm-agrees-to-settle-50-new-death-cases-related-to-ignition-switch---total-reaches-174-300145191.html
